metadata.subject: Japan Economics Viewpoint - Ready for ignition

relationships.description: Japan Economist at Merrill Lynch Japan
Economic and trade relationship between Japan and US
Upcoming summit meeting between Japanese and Russian leaders

analysis.purpose: Economic analysis and forecasting of Japan's economic outlook for 2017-2018
analysis.significance: Comprehensive economic research report providing bullish outlook on Japan's economy with detailed analysis of fiscal/monetary policy, domestic demand, and external risks

notable_quotes: We are upbeat on Japan's outlook and think consensus is underestimating the strength of medium-term GDP and inflation.
For the first time in four years both monetary and fiscal policy are supporting growth.
The biggest risk factor: US policy uncertainty - chief among them rising US protectionism, sliding global trade, and a stronger yen.

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found - this is a standard economic research report

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed - this is legitimate economic analysis and forecasting

public_knowledge.context: Economic research reports from major financial institutions are typically distributed to clients and may become publicly available. This type of macroeconomic analysis would be of interest to financial media and investors.

analysis.summary: Merrill Lynch Japan economist Izumi Devalier provides an optimistic economic outlook for Japan, forecasting 1.4% GDP growth in 2017 and 1.2% in 2018, well above consensus estimates, citing aligned monetary and fiscal policy support, recovering domestic demand, and improved global export conditions, while noting US policy uncertainty as the primary risk factor.
